page.title: 18Mining in Caerau
page.content: Many families are now experiecing difficulties due to the closiure of {collieries}in the immediate area. {Caerau Colliery}was closed in 1977 and many of the miners who worked in that colliery were transferred to{Coegnant {colliery}which is lower down the valley. Then recently Coegnant Colliery was closed after a long struggle between the{Union}and the {N.C.B. to}keep it open. As a result many of the miners were made redundant though some were fortunate enough to find work in factories in Bridgend. Others were transferred to{Saint Johns {Colliery}in{Maesteg.}However that colliery which is the last in the Llynfi valley is under threat of closure. I this happens{unemployment will be increased and cause even greater problems in the valley.
